title.narrative: Improving Health of HIV+ Prisoners in Zimbabwe

description.narrative: 420 Prisoners will be trained to be peer educators . 5380 male and female prisoners living with HIV or at risk will be primary beneficiaries. 60 Prison Officials with focal responsibility for health and rehabilitation within the four prisons will also benefit. Indirect beneficiaries are the 21300 dependants (including 140 breastfeeding Infants) and the communities into which over 1000 prisoners are expected to be released over the next 3 years.

Main focus is to work with prisoners and prison staff in the 4 target prisons to improve prison conditions, treatment and livelihood options for HIV+ prisoners and to reduce the risk of further transmission of HIV both in and outside of the prison environment. Strategies to improve prevention include awareness raising, peer support, counselling and advocacy
The project will work on 4 prisons in Harare and Masvingo Districts of Zimbabwe, improving the quality of life of vulnerable prison populations affected and or infected by HIV AIDS.
